intro: Monochlaena racemosa, commonly known as the clustered thornapple, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically covered in a fine, white powder. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
